Jack soon discovers that he has been placed in a prison run by an insane dictator who wants to take over the world. conversation.text:
Based on the preferences given, here are two movie recommendations: 
- "The Future of Us" (2011) directed by David Fincher and starring Ryan Gosling and Keira Knightley. This movie is about a young man named Andrew who has just graduated from college and is now starting his first job at an investment bank called Lehman Brothers. Andrew's boss, Morgan Stanley CEO James Dimon, takes Andrew under his wing and teaches him the ropes of being a successful businessman in today's fast-paced global economy. Andrew learns a lot from James Dimon and starts to see himself as a future successful entrepreneur just like James Dimon did when he started his own investment bank called Lehman Brothers decades ago. "In the Company of Men" (1997) directed by David Fincher and starring Matt Malloy and Stacy Edwards. This movie is about two business executives--one an avowed misogynist, the other recently emotionally wounded by his love interest--set out to exact revenge on the female gender by seeking out the most innocent, uncorrupted girl they can find and ruining her life.
